Key Match Events: Juan Soto hit a three-run homer with two outs in the 10th inning
Giancarlo Stanton hit a two-run homer in the sixth inning
Andrés Giménez made an error on a soft toss from Hunter Gaddis
Pre-Game Insights: The Yankees acquired Juan Soto in a seven-player trade from San Diego in December
General Manager Brian Cashman pulled off the deal for Soto
Yankees fans chanted ‘Re-sign Soto!’ during the postgame festivities
Post-Match Reflections: Aaron Boone said, 'We’re right where we belong'
Boone added, 'We get to play for a world championship, that's pretty sweet.'
Vogt said, 'There’s only one team that gets to win the last game of the year, and unfortunately it’s not going to be us.'
Boone mentioned, 'This was a rollercoaster and we were able to just keep punching back'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was played at Progressive Field in Cleveland
The Yankees won in five games
Carlos Rodón allowed a leadoff single to Steven Kwan in the fifth inning
Lane Thomas grounded out on the first pitch to him from Mark Leiter Jr.
